description: This course aims to help students expand vocabulary, develop reading skills and reading comprehension through reading a wide variety of articles related to our local cultures; meanwhile, students can link the reading texts to practice writing skills and are able to write at least two-paragraph long cohesive essays. By revising the drafts of their own writing, students will also gain self-editing experience. Since the reading texts are related to the local history and cultures of Taiwan, this course also prepares the students to become a global citizen with the perspectives of glocalization as well as consciousness of Taiwanization.

syllabus.zh:
1.幫助學生熟悉英文閱讀技巧,例如根據上下文判斷字義。
2.培養獨立閱讀英文文章之能力,例如如何掌握文章大意。
3.閱讀不同類型的文章,強化學生辨識文章組織結構之能力。
4.使學生熟悉英文寫作不同文體的寫作策略。
5.引導學生認識台灣歷史與文化，養成深具台灣主體意識兼具世界觀的公民。
syllabus.en:
1.To familiarize students with English reading skills, such as getting meanings of the words from context
2.To develop students’ abilities to read English texts independently, such as understanding the main idea
3.To help students read different types of texts and to enhance their abilities of identifying the text structure
4.To familiarize students with writing strategies of different genres
5.Guide students to learn about Taiwanese history and cultures to raise students’ awareness of Taiwanization as well as becoming a global citizen with the perspectives of glocalization.

teachingAndAssessment.objective: Discussion / learning topics from different disciplines, and moral themes related to modern society.
Students will have classroom discussions, work in groups, and complete assignments.
Students will communicate orally with one another in a relaxed environment.
Students will develop English reading and writing skills.
Students will use online resources to write, collaborate and edit written work.
Students will learn how to integrate with others via oral communication.
